abstract: Still wrapped up in a hotly contested battle for market share that includes lawsuits against its key rivals, a mobile e-mail software developer, Visto, has extended its $51 million Series C funding by accepting an additional $35 million from Altitude Capital Partners. The new money builds on $280 million in existing funding raised over the past decade, spread out over eight rounds including a 2001 recapitalization.
lead_paragraph: Still wrapped up in a hotly contested battle for market share that includes lawsuits against its key rivals, a mobile e-mail software developer, Visto, has extended its $51 million Series C funding by accepting an additional $35 million from Altitude Capital Partners. The new money builds on $280 million in existing funding raised over the past decade, spread out over eight rounds including a 2001 recapitalization.

headline.main: Visto Tops Up Haul With $35 Million
